properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions tonight and Tuesday in Naujaat. Strong northwest winds with gusts to 70 km/h will affect Naujaat beginning overnight tonight. Blizzard conditions, with near-zero visibility in blowing snow, will result. Blizzard conditions will ease Tuesday evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-23T12:37:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-22T20:38:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3781284638.2021
Area: Naujaat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued For The Town Of Turtleford.
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the town of Turtleford. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water the Turtleford water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2021-03-01T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2021-02-22T09:50:13-06:00, 30880A4C-18D9-D715-DCA7-77904116F713
Area: town of Turtleford
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard tonight at Rankin Inlet and Whale Cove. Strong northwest winds are causing near-zero visibilities in blowing snow along the Hudson Bay coast. Blizzard conditions will continue until Tuesday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-23T19:18:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T03:19:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0861373141.2021
Area: Rankin Region including Whale Cove
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 15 cm is expected. Locations: Prince County Time span: tonight until Tuesday morning. Remarks: Periods of snow are expected across Prince Edward Island tonight through to Tuesday morning, with highest amounts of 15cm for western regions. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to PEstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #PEStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-23T17:19:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T01:55:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1931121171.2021
Area: Prince County P.E.I.
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow is expected. Total snowfall: 10 to 15 cm, with locally higher amounts possible. Locations: central and northeastern Newfoundland. Time span: Tuesday afternoon to near midday on Wednesday. Remarks: Snow is expected to spread across central and northeastern Newfoundland Tuesday afternoon. Winds will strengthen Tuesday night causing blowing snow and reduced visibility, mainly over exposed areas. In the northeast, snow will taper to freezing drizzle or briefly to rain and drizzle on Tuesday night before changing back to snow Wednesday morning. Over central areas, snow will continue into Wednesday morning with further, but minor, accumulations. Snow will taper off over all areas by Wednesday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-02-23T17:38:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T01:39:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2058806646.2021
Area: Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Buchans and the interior, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Bay of Exploits, Bonavista North, Bonavista Peninsula, Clarenville and vicinity, Gander and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay, Terra Nova
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A multi-day episode of very cold wind chills is expected. Extreme cold temperatures near minus 55 and minus 60 will return overnight. While temperatures will moderate somewhat during the day, these extreme cold temperatures may persist through to the end of the week. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-23T20:35:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T04:36:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1016998485.2021
Area: Sachs Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow, rain, and strong winds are expected. Total snowfall: 5 to 10 cm. Total rainfall: 5 to 10 mm, except potentially higher amounts over the southern Avalon and Burin Peninsulas. Maximum wind gusts: up to 80 km/h. Locations: Burin and Avalon Peninsulas. Time span: Tuesday afternoon until overnight Tuesday night. Remarks: Snow or rain will begin near noon Tuesday or later in the afternoon before changing over to rain early in the evening. Strong winds will also develop late Tuesday afternoon, with the highest gusts along the coast in the evening. Conditions will improve Tuesday night as rain tapers to drizzle and flurries. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-02-23T17:35:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T01:36:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0528211357.2021
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, Avalon Peninsula Southeast, St. John's and vicinity, Avalon Peninsula Southwest, Burin Peninsula
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Snow continues for the Trans-Canada Highway - Eagle Pass to Rogers Pass section. An additional 10 cm of snow can be expected for tonight as snow levels drop and an unstable airmass settles into the Columbia region. The heavier snow is expected to ease off to periods of snow by Tuesday morning. Total snow accumulations near the summit may range from 25 to 35 cm by Tuesday morning. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-23T17:54:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T01:55:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2457477189.2021
Area: Trans-Canada Highway - Eagle Pass to Rogers Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall expected beginning Tuesday. Total snowfall: near 10 cm, with higher amounts possible inland and over higher terrain. Maximum wind gusts: up to 80 km/h. Locations: Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity to Connaigre. Time span: midday Tuesday through Tuesday night. Remarks: Snow is expected to spread across southwestern Newfoundland on Tuesday before changing to rain or drizzle in the evening. Strong winds will cause a brief period blowing snow and reduced visibility in some locations near midday on Tuesday. Conditions will improve Tuesday night as rain tapers to drizzle and flurries. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-02-23T17:36:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T01:37:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3432137960.2021
Area: Connaigre, Burgeo - Ramea, Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 20 cm is expected. A disturbance will bring heavy flurries to the region this evening. Upwards of 15 cm of snow is possible. Conditions should begin to improve near midnight. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-23T11:29:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T01:36:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2822819828.2021
Area: Yoho Park - Kootenay Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wreckhouse Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: southeasterly near 100 km/h in the Wreckhouse area. Time span: Tuesday afternoon. ### Wreckhouse wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-02-23T17:38:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-23T01:39:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1238686998.2021
Area: Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity

properties.Title: Les Suêtes Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum Les Suetes gusts: 100 km/h. Time span: early Tuesday morning, diminishing mid-day. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Les Suêtes wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
